class_notes: This survey course will introduce you to anthropology's distinctive perspective on becoming and being human through the sub-fields of cultural anthropology, biological anthropology, archaeology, linguistics, and applied anthropology. Ultimately, you will learn to examine your social worlds and the human differences you encounter through an anthropological lens and to think anthropologically about human possibility and the future.
course_description: Survey of the study of the human species: its evolution, prehistory, language, and comparative social and cultural systems.
